questions.question_text: Which of the following events is MOST likely to trigger an update to the risk register?

choices.D: A post-implementation review of a new application has been initiated by senior management.
choices.C: A project to implement a risk response action plan has been completed and closed successfully.
choices.B: A business case for implementing a new solution for automating controls has been proposed.
choices.A: A reminder to reassess an identified risk has been sent to risk owners and risk custodians.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is: **C. A project to implement a risk response action plan has been completed and closed successfully.**

Explanation:

The risk register is a comprehensive document that records identified risks, their assessment, and the strategies employed to manage them. It is updated throughout the project lifecycle, especially when significant events occur that affect risk status. Completing and closing a project aimed at implementing a risk response action plan signifies that specific risks have been addressed. This development necessitates updating the risk register to reflect the current status of these risks, including any changes in their severity, the effectiveness of the mitigation strategies, and any residual risks that may remain.

Selected Answer: BD

Position to Observe Issues: The organization needs mechanisms and tools to monitor processes and environments so that potential risks can be spotted early.

Answer is C. The question state "you have planned the risk response process and now you are about to implement various controls." Since you have not actually implemented the control, you do not have any data to evaluate the performance. The only other logical answer is to pilot test the control before implementation in production. Answer is C.

Selected Answer: C
Before relying on any controls, it is important to conduct pilot testing to ensure that the controls are effective and can be implemented as planned. Pilot testing allows the project team to test the controls in a controlled environment, and to make any necessary adjustments before fully implementing them. This can help to prevent errors, delays, and additional costs that could be incurred if the controls were found to be ineffective or not feasible after implementation.

A. Reviewing performance data refers to evaluating how well the controls are working, discovering risk exposure refers to identifying and analyzing new risks, and articulating risk refers to clearly and effectively communicating risks to stakeholders.

Selected Answer: C
C. Conduct pilot testing

Pilot testing involves implementing the controls on a smaller scale or in a controlled environment to assess their effectiveness and identify any potential issues or unforeseen consequences. It allows you to test whether the selected controls can effectively mitigate the identified risks before fully implementing them across the entire project. Conducting pilot testing helps ensure that the controls are practical and that they will work as intended in the actual project environment. This step is crucial for risk management as it helps verify that the chosen controls are appropriate and do not introduce new risks or problems.

questions.question_text: Which of the following items is considered as an objective of the three dimensional model within the framework described in COSO ERM?
questions.answer_description:
The COSO ERM (Enterprise Risk Management) frame work is a 3-dimensional model. The dimensions and their components include:
✑ Strategic Objectives - includes strategic, operations, reporting, and compliance.
✑ Risk Components - includes Internal Environment, Objectives settings, Event identification, Risk assessment, Risk response, Control activities, Information and communication, and monitoring.
✑ Organizational Levels - include subsidiary, business unit, division, and entity-level.
The COSO ERM framework contains eight risk components:
✑ Internal Environment
✑ Objective Settings
✑ Event Identification
✑ Risk Assessment
✑ Risk Response
✑ Control Activities
✑ Information and Communication
✑ Monitoring
Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oley act specifies a three dimensional model- COSO ERM, comprised of Internal control components, Internal control objectives, and organization entities. All the items listed are components except Financial reporting which is an internal control objective.
Incorrect Answers:
A, C, D: They are the Internal control components, not the Internal control objectives.
